title: Definitions
context: §463-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Board&rdquo; means the board of private detectives and guards described in section 463-2. &ldquo;Detective&rdquo;, &ldquo;private detective&rdquo;, or &ldquo;investigator&rdquo; means a licensed person qualified to obtain information and evidence not readily or publicly accessible. &ldquo;Detective agency&rdquo; or &ldquo;private detective agency&rdquo; means a licensed firm engaged in the private detective business. &ldquo;Firm&rdquo; means a sole proprietor, corporation, joint venture, limited liability partnership, limited liability corporation, partnership, association, or any other legal business entity. &ldquo;Guard&rdquo; [Repeal and reenactment on July 1, 2016. L 2010, c 208, §8.] means a registered uniformed or nonuniformed person responsible for the safekeeping of a client&rsquo;s properties and persons within contractually prescribed boundaries, and for observation and reporting relative to such safekeeping. &ldquo;Guard&rdquo; shall not include any active duty federal, state, or county law enforcement officers or personnel. &ldquo;Guard agency&rdquo; means a licensed firm engaged in the guard business. &ldquo;Principal detective&rdquo; means a licensed detective designated as the detective agency&rsquo;s primary licensee who is fully responsible for the direct management and control of the agency and the agency&rsquo;s employees. &ldquo;Principal guard&rdquo; means a licensed guard designated as the guard agency&rsquo;s primary licensee who is fully responsible for the direct management and control of the agency and the agency&rsquo;s employees. [L 1961, c 77, pt of §1; Supp, §165A-1; HRS §463-1; am L 1983, c 40, §1; am L 1994, c 122, §1; am L 2004, c 94, §1; am L 2010, c 208, §2] Note Definition of &ldquo;guard&rdquo;: Repeal and reenactment on July 1, 2016, by L 2010, c 208, §8 deleted by L 2014, c 94, §3.
